$SOXL $USD  
 
 
Miscioscia said that despite the wider issues weighing on the chip sector, the "positive fundamentals" of the industry haven't changed. Miscioscia pointed to what he called "material tech drivers" that are having an effect on the chip sector: Artificial intelligence and industrial automation, gaming, cloud computing, 5G wireless, electric vehicles and advanced driver assistance systems, and new demands from enterprises as employees begin returning to the office. 
 
"We believe the positive tech demand will eventually result in good growth," Miscioscia said, adding that share prices should rebound through the year. 
 
Miscioscia said that heading into the upcoming earnings season, his "top picks" include Advanced Micro Devices ($AMD) and Apple ($AAPL).

$SPY $TSLA $AAPL $GOOGL $FB 

My thoughts on today's mkt .... 

In my pre-mkt commentary to members I mentioned I see the mkt pulling back to the  SPY 419.5/420.5 level (SEE BELOW) We traded just under before bouncing. I also mentioned an hour into trading that if these lows hold, we could move back to 427.5ish. 

We came into today a bit oversold on the RSI. As I told members in pre-mkt, we can expect some money to flow back into big cap tech ahead of earnings. That not everyone is convinced they are going to dissapoint. And that is exactly what we saw today. 

So now where are we headed? Mkts love to trap. We get a ton leaning one way, watch out for that reversal. The "Generals " start reporting tomorrow and they will shape the technical levels for months to come. Buckle up. ✌️
$SPY $NFLX is easily the best stock to own long term $AAPL $AMD

4/25/2022 
 
Chart: 4hr 180d 
 
AAPL had a beautiful bear trap today! They were trying to hold this 160 level as a strong low. I am expecting a bounce back to 164-165 range, that would be their first 'supply zone'. Sit tight on AAPL as we have ER on Thursday. On top of that AAPL is touching their 1d 5yr 200sma, this could give them a huge chance to run back up. (last time they touched their 200sma they bounced to almost $180).
